summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from late May to early June 2023, primarily discussing scheduling and a request for information related to a 'Leon Black review.' The emails reference an interview with a victim and a trial the sender is involved in.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The central subject of the 'review' or 'due diligence' being discussed in the emails. The correspondents are trying to obtain notes and a list of victims from this review.

persons.name: Jane
persons.context: An email correspondent who inquires about scheduling a meeting and requests interview notes and a victim list from the 'Leon Black review.'

connections.description: Jane is seeking information (interview notes, victim list) from a review or due diligence process concerning Leon Black.

events.title: Email exchange regarding Leon Black review
events.description: A series of emails discussing scheduling and a request for information related to a review or due diligence process involving Leon Black.

events.title: Correspondent's trial
events.description: One of the email correspondents mentions being in court all day for a marathon Final Pre-Trial Conference (FPTC) and hearing, and later mentions second-seating a trial the following week.

keyFacts: The emails discuss a 'Leon Black review' that involved interviewing at least one victim.
One correspondent states, 'the only victim we interviewed was [text cuts off]', indicating a specific victim was part of the review.
The correspondence is focused on obtaining notes and a list of victims from this review process.
The emails are dated in 2023, indicating ongoing legal or investigative activity related to Epstein associates years after Epstein's death.
